New Records: It is the first time in European Championship history that all four teams in a single group are on equal points after two match weeks.
Belgium have not drawn a match at the European Championship since a 0-0 stalemate against Italy at the 1980 tournament, all of 19 games ago.
Belgium have won exactly half of their all-time meetings against Romania (six from 12). This was their first clash at a major tournament.
Key Match Events: Youri Tielemans scored in the 2nd minute.
Kevin De Bruyne scored in the 80th minute.
Kevin De Bruyne was named Player of the Match by UEFA.
Romelu Lukaku had a goal disallowed by VAR for the third time in two games.
Koen Casteels made terrific saves in both halves, stepping in for the injured Thibaut Courtois.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium boss Domenico Tedesco expressed relief at winning the game and emphasized the importance of the three points.
Tedesco praised the team's high pressing and mentality against Romania.
Romania's coach Edward Iordanescu acknowledged Belgium's quality and expressed faith in his team's ability to improve.
Iordanescu mentioned that with a bit of luck, Romania could have gotten a point from the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place in Cologne, Germany, which is just two hours from Belgium.
Belgium fans stayed to cheer the substitutes' warm-down after the match.
Kevin De Bruyne's performance was highlighted as the emotional and technical heartbeat of the team.
The gap between Gheorghe Hagi's last European Championship match and his son Ianis Hagi's appearance in this tournament was 8760 days.
